refnamediv.refpurpose: Windows registry file browser using readline

refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: regshell is a utility that lets you browse thru a Windows registry file as if you were using a regular unix shell to browse thru a file system.

listitem.para: Name of backend to load. Possible values are: creg, regf, dir and rpc. The default is dir.
Credentials to use, if any. Password should be separated from user name by a percent sign.
Go to the specified predefined key.
List subkeys and values of the current key.
Create a key with the specified keyname as a subkey of the current key.
Print the full name of the current key.
Update the value of a key value. Not implemented at the moment.
Print a list of available commands.

refsect1.title: EXAMPLES
refsect1.para: Browsing thru a nt4 registry file
refsect1.screen: regshell -b nt4 NTUSER.DAT $$$PROTO.HIV> ls K AppEvents K Console K Control Panel K Environment K Identities K Keyboard Layout K Network K Printers K Software K UNICODE Program Groups K Windows 3.1 Migration Status $$$PROTO.HIV> exit
refsect1.para: Listing the subkeys of HKEY_CURRENT_USER\AppEvents on a remote computer:
refsect1.screen: regshell --remote=ncacn_np:aurelia -c "jelmer%secret" HKEY_CURRENT_MACHINE> predef HKEY_CURRENT_USER HKEY_CURRENT_USER> cd AppEvents Current path is: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\AppEvents HKEY_CURRENT_USER\AppEvents> ls K EventLabels K Schemes HKEY_CURRENT_USER\AppEvents> exit

refsect1.title: VERSION
refsect1.para: This man page is correct for version 4.0 of the Samba suite.

refsect1.title: AUTHOR
refsect1.para: This utility is part of the Samba suite, which is developed by the global Samba Team.
This manpage and regshell were written by Jelmer Vernooij.
